newsitem.title: UK: Common cold virus targets prostate cancer.
newsitem.headline: Common cold virus targets prostate cancer.

text.p: Researchers trying to find a quick and easy cure for prostate cancer have designed a common cold virus that attacks only prostate cells, New Scientist magazine reported on Thursday.

It said the scientists at California biotech company Calydon and Johns Hopkins University had engineered the virus so that it would attack only cells producing prostate specific antigen, a protein found almost exclusively in prostate cells.
The virus also destroyed normal prostate cells but then so did surgery or chemotherapy, the researchers said, noting that the prostate was anyway not vital for fertility or sexual potency.
Calydon said tests in mice showed the tumours shrank dramatically within six weeks. The researchers want to start human clinical trials soon.
